skill.name: Skill Development
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user wants to "create a skill", "add a skill to plugin", "write a new skill", "improve skill description", "organize skill content", or needs guidance on skill structure, progressive disclosure, or skill development best practices for Claude Code plugins.

security_audit.summary: This is an official skill source and is pre-reviewed. No detailed security scan was required for publication readiness.

content.user_title: Create Claude Code skills with clear structure
content.value_statement: You need a reliable process to design plugin skills that trigger correctly and stay lean. This skill provides step by step guidance, templates, and checks for Claude Code skills.
actual_capabilities: Explain the required skill directory structure for Claude Code plugins
Provide a step by step workflow for creating or improving skills
Define frontmatter description rules with specific trigger phrases
Outline progressive disclosure and where to place references, scripts, and assets
Provide a validation checklist for structure, style, and testing
limitations: Does not generate skill files or assets automatically
Does not execute validation or test scripts
Focuses on Claude Code plugin skills, not generic skill packaging
Requires user supplied examples and domain details

use_cases.title: Build a new plugin skill
use_cases.description: Plan the skill structure, write frontmatter triggers, and set up references, scripts, and examples.

use_cases.title: Improve skill documentation
use_cases.description: Refactor SKILL.md to be lean, imperative, and aligned with progressive disclosure.

use_cases.title: Validate skill readiness
use_cases.description: Review structure, trigger phrases, and testing steps before shipping a plugin.

prompt_templates.title: Start a new skill
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a first draft skill plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a skill plan for a Claude Code plugin that supports onboarding new users. Include trigger phrases and required directories.

prompt_templates.title: Fix my frontmatter
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this frontmatter description and rewrite it in third person with specific trigger phrases: [paste description]

prompt_templates.title: Refactor SKILL.md
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this SKILL.md section in imperative form and move details into references: [paste section]

prompt_templates.title: Full validation pass
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a checklist review of my skill folder. List missing files, weak triggers, and test gaps.

output_examples.input: Review my plugin skill and suggest improvements to trigger phrases and structure.
output: Your description lists general terms. Add exact phrases like create a skill and add a skill to plugin.
SKILL.md is long. Move detailed examples into references and keep core steps in the main file.
Add a references section that points to each supporting document.

best_practices: Use third person trigger phrases in frontmatter
Keep SKILL.md lean and move details to references
Validate structure, style, and referenced files before testing
anti_patterns: Writing in second person or advisory tone
Packing all details into SKILL.md without references

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. It targets Claude Code plugin skills and uses conventions that Codex can follow.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance only. It does not run tests or generate files automatically.

faq.question: How do I integrate it into my plugin workflow?
faq.answer: Place the skill under your plugin skills directory and follow the structure and checklist.

faq.question: Does it handle sensitive data safely?
faq.answer: It does not process data directly. Keep sensitive content out of skill files.

faq.question: What should I do if the skill does not trigger?
faq.answer: Strengthen trigger phrases in frontmatter and test with those exact user queries.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic skill creators?
faq.answer: It is tailored to Claude Code plugins and avoids packaging steps used by generic skills.
